_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1.0 EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

This document has been prepared to demonstrate how the Heinz Frozen Foods facility in Florence, SC complies with the requirements set forth under EPA's Chemical Accidental Prevention Provisions (40 CFR 68). This plan has been developed specifically to address the requirements applicable to the use of anhydrous ammonia at the facility. Each of the following sections provides a general overview of the requirements and defines the facility design attributes, documentation, and actions that are established to comply with those requirements. 


1.1    Description of the Accident Release Prevention and Emergency Policies

Heinz Frozen Foods is committed in providing to all employees a work environment that is free from recognized health and safety hazards. Accordingly, our goal is achieving and sustaining "Zero Accident Tolerance" through communication, information, and training. To this end, we are dedicated to the concept that all employees receive the proper orientation and are provided with the means necessary to ensure the environment remains as safe and healthful as possible.

It is the policy of Heinz Frozen Food to:

o Provide safe working conditions, proper tools, and personal protective equipment.

o Comply with all federal, state, and local occupational health and safety laws and regulations.

o Provide and sustain a high level of commitment to ensure all employees have a safe and healthy work environment in which to work.

o Ensure, through training, and when necessary disciplinary action, that all employees work in a safe manner.

o Educate and/or train all employees in safe work practices, and ensure that each employee fully understands his or her job, equipment, techniques, and methods to reduce the risk to himself or herself and their co-workers.

o Encourage all employees to "Think Safety", so that safety habits developed and practiced at work carry through to non-work related activities.

This facility's aim is to provide a profession

al service as efficiently as possible while minimizing the use of toxic materials where ever and whenever prudent. In this effort our highest priority will be the proactive pursuit of cost-effective process changes that reduce or eliminate the use and/or generation of hazardous toxics at the endpoint of service. Where hazardous toxics cannot be eliminated, improving controls to handle these substances will be explored and implemented wherever possible.

The Senior Facility Manager has overall responsible for the safety and environmental programs at the facility.


1.2    Facility Description

The Heinz Frozen Foods facility in Florence, SC is a food processing facility where food ingredients are received, blended, mixed, cooked, assembled, frozen and packaged for shipment to end users.  The substance regulated under the Chemical Accident Prevention Provisions (40 CFR 68) that is located on-site, in various locations and quantities is anhydrous ammonia.  The ammonia contained in various vessels, piping, and heat exchangers is used in an ammonia refrigeration system.  The machine room houses the majority of the refrigeration equipment.


1.3    Description of the Accidental Release Prevention Program

Heinz Frozen Foods has prepared a facility safety policy and procedures program specifically tailored for the facility.  The facility has a program level 3 accident release prevention program for the ammonia refrigeration system that complies with OSHA's Process Safety Management Standard and EPA's Chemical Accidental Prevention Provisions.  The program consists of the following elements:

o Employee Participation Program
o Process Safety Information
o Process Hazard Analysis
o Operating Procedures
o Training Program
o Contractor Safety Program
o Pre-Startup Safety Review Procedures
o Mechanical Integrity Program
o Hot Work Permit Procedures
o Management of Change Procedures
o Incident Investigation Procedures
o Compliance Audit Procedures


1.4    Five-Year Accident History

The

re have not been any ammonia-related incidents at the Heinz Frozen Foods facility in Florence, SC during the previous five years that resulted in significant on-site or offsite consequences.


1.5    Emergency Response Program

The Florence facility is equipped with an emergency warning system. Alarms are placed throughout the facility to alarm personnel of an emergency relating to the accidental release of ammonia or other emergencies that may be encountered. There are specific procedures that all employees must follow in the event of release.  These procedures include evacuation of personnel, notification of authorities and actions to be taken to stop, or mitigate the emergency if it is safe to do so.

The Windy Hill Fire Department has visited the facility to review the process operations, safety systems and discuss emergency response coordination.


1.6    Planned Changes to Improve Safety

There are no current plans to improve safety at the Florence facility.  Future changes will be evaluated and implemented as required.
